A1: bilateral relation between Nepal and India
RelatedSentence: KATHMANDU : India 's would - be prime minister Narendra Modi , who represents the pro-Hindu Bharatiya Janata Party ( BJP ) , has assured to strengthen bilateral relation between Nepal and India in various spheres .
We are committed to strengthening our relations with Nepal in various spheres , Modi 's latest tweet posted 13 hours ago reads .
Modi also thanked President Dr Ram Baran Yadav , Prime Minister Sushil Koirala and former prime minister and UCPN - Maoist leader Dr Baburam Bhattarai for their wishes to his election victory .
Posting the most resounding victory in India 's election history in last 30 years , BJP alone won at least 275 of 543 seats in the Parliament .
Posting the most resounding victory in India 's election history in last 30 years , BJP alone won at least 275 of 543 seats in the Parliament .
Earlier yesterday , Prime Minister Sushil Koirala had called up Modi and congratulated him for the BJP 's victory in the Indian general elections .
The Nepali executive head has invited Modi to visit Nepal after the latter assumes his office in New Delhi .
